titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Fiorello H. LaGuardia letters to Fannie M. Neumann 1974.241
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T11:15-0500

did.unittitle: Fiorello H. LaGuardia letters to Fannie M. Neumann

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Fiorello H. LaGuardia (1882-1947) was Mayor of New York City from 1934 to 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of four short letters from Fiorello H. LaGuardia, Mayor of New York City, to Fannie M. Neumann (also spelled Newmann) of 1363 Albany Avenue in Brooklyn. The letters span 1938 to 1947 and mainly convey LaGuardia's thanks to Neumann for the receipt of letters and cards, though one letter concerns Neumann's unspecified complaints about Coney Island boats.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Collection formally accessioned in 1974.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Fiorello H. LaGuardia letters to Fannie M. Neumann, 1974.241, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
